intro: Restio oligostachyus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and mountainous regions. Restio oligostachyus is often found in fynbos vegetation and is adapted to Mediterranean climate conditions.
